A study was conducted to determine the length of time (in months) that a particular brand of smartphone lasts before it needs to be replaced. After following 500 participants over a period of two years, it was found that the survival function for the smartphone was: 
S(t) = 0.8^(t/20), where t is the time (in months) since purchase. 

What is the probability that the smartphone will last at least 12 months before it needs to be replaced?
message_2:
To find the probability that the smartphone will last at least 12 months before it needs to be replaced, we need to evaluate the survival function S(t) at t = 12 months.

S(12) = 0.8^(12/20)

S(12) = 0.8^0.6

So, the probability that the smartphone will last at least 12 months before it needs to be replaced is approximately 0.8912 or 89.12%.
